meanings.definition: Seven times as great or as numerous.
meanings.sent1: The small plant grew sevenfold after the rain.
meanings.sent2: The baker made a sevenfold increase in his bread production.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's stash of acorns multiplied sevenfold overnight!
meanings.sent4: Her joy at winning the race was sevenfold greater than her disappointment at losing last time.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was to make a single flower bloom sevenfold.

meanings.sent1: She decided to sevenfold her savings by investing in stocks.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for her to sevenfold the ingredients to make a large batch of cookies.
meanings.sent3: He tried to sevenfold his strength by drinking a special potion.
meanings.sent4: The artist's goal was to sevenfold his artistic skills by practicing every day.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to sevenfold their efforts for the upcoming exam.

meanings.sent1: The athlete ran sevenfold faster than his competitors.
meanings.sent2: She checked her watch and realized she was sevenfold late for the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed sevenfold louder when it wanted attention.
meanings.sent4: The music blared sevenfold louder than usual at the concert.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks lit up the sky sevenfold brighter than the stars.
